fields.description:
* add action button enables when no policies have been selected
* partially filled out the alarm action thing, without adding, and then did save changes. It should flag that like when you populate a tag without saving the tag (see instance details) and warn you but it doesn't
fields.summary: Cloudwatch - Alarm Actions Directive - Validation Issues

comments.body:
Oh good gawd, I think we're there.

Should see proper button enable/disable throughout, on alarm detail, create alarm and copy alarm.

So close! a couple of small nits:
* I'm on chrome on El Capitan, and I see the cursor change to the hand when I mouse over the disabled add action, create alarm, copy alarm submit, and save changes on alarm detail page buttons 
* disabled style for add action AND for submit buttons in all cases is not correct, those are disabled primary buttons and the disabled color for the button border should be $hpe-disabled-green
* no warning when action is left defined but un-added (see tag editor for behavior example of how this should act when the user fills it out but doesn't click the add button before submitting the form)

Color and pointer issues addressed.
Validation modal and message moved to GUI-2581

UX review passed, ready for code review!

IMPORTANT: Some of the styling changes here to disabled button styles should also affect GUI-2544 so this may need to be pulled in there (or that styling work needs to be duplicated for disabled primary buttons (add action button and the overall form submit button)
Punting back to address merge conflicts in PR

[~ashamblin]: There are a bunch of merge conflicts in PR 1914, but I'm going to take a stab a resolving those conflicts since that PR may potentially conflict with my work on GUI-2354.  Will keep you posted.

/cc [~jloza]

[~ashamblin]: I've merged PR 1914, but I noticed the Add Actions button isn't enabling when the scaling group and policy are selected in the create alarm dialog on the resource monitoring pages. Screenshot of an example on the ELB Monitoring page is attached.

Clarifying, I performed the merged and resolved the conflicts.

Add Actions button passed UX review, will have to dig in and find where the conflicting code introduced the bug.
Validation issues in create alarm dialog on resource monitoring pages fixed in https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1942

Seems to be OK now (tested on instance details). 

Thanks, [~kgill]! Ready for code review.
